metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6821 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ff_mpv_common_init function in libavcodec/mpegvideo.c in FFmpeg before 2.7.2 does not properly maintain the encoding context, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid pointer access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted MPEG data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6821` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2016-03-11, no equivalent fix in libav code is different in precise, probably ok ebarretto> as of 2018-09-27, no equivalent fix in libav

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
